usefulItems: snaplock bag, large frying pan, casserole dish (28 cm), aluminium foil, bowl, 6 serving bowls, oven, stove top
title: Lamb shanks with risoni and feta

ingredients.content: 3 pieces lemon zest (approx. 1 x 10 cm strips), no white pith
4 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
20 g olive oil, plus extra for frying
1 tsp salt, plus extra for seasoning
1 tsp freshly ground black pepper, plus extra for seasoning
200 g carrot, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
200 g zucchini, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
4 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
200 g firm feta cheese, cut into cubes (2 cm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 160°C. Place lemon, parsley, garlic and eschalots into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and wine and cook <b>3 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, <b> without measuring cup<b>.
Add passata, water, stock paste, tomato paste, salt and pepper and cook <b>10 min/100°C/speed 1<b>. Set aside in mixing bowl.
Place shanks and flour into a large snaplock plastic bag and season with salt and pepper. Seal bag and shake to coat, then set aside.

Place a large frying pan over medium-high heat and add oil. Add lamb shanks to pan in batches and sear on each side (approx. 3-4 minutes each side) until browned. Transfer lamb into a casserole dish (approx. 28 cm).
Carefully pour reserved passata mixture over lamb, secure with a tight-fitting lid or aluminium foil and bake for 2½ hours (160°C).
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh carrots, zucchini, olives and risoni pasta into it. Set bowl aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Carefully remove casserole dish from oven, add carrot mixture to casserole dish and gently stir to combine. Cover and bake for a further 40 minutes (160°C) or until lamb is tender. Meanwhile, make feta topping.
Place garlic, parsley, thyme and chilli flakes into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and lemon juice and sauté <b>3 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Divide shanks between 6 serving bowls and top with warm feta to serve.
